alert.note: Alert for Bannock; Caribou; Cassia; Franklin; Oneida; Power (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:17PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CARIBOU...ONEIDA...SOUTHEASTERN BANNOCK... SOUTHEASTERN POWER...WESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHEASTERN CASSIA COUNTIES... At 716 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles west of Juniper to 7 miles west of Holbrook Summit to 8 miles southwest of Cherry Creek Rest Area, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Malad, Swanlake, Downey, Arimo, Rockland, Juniper, Holbrook Summit, Pleasantview, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Cherry Creek Rest Area, Virginia, Dayton, Weston, Clifton, Oxford, Stone, Sweetzer Summit, Hawkins Reservoir, Samaria, and Arbon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Pocatello.

area.areaDesc: Bannock; Caribou; Cassia; Franklin; Oneida; Power
